doc.previous: The term Interweb is a portmanteau of Internet and World Wide Web typically used sarcastically to parody a technically unsavvy user
doc.after: Research into packet switching started in the early 1960s and packet switched networks such as Mark I at NPL in the UK 15 ARPANET CYCLADES 16 17 Merit Network 18 Tymnet and Telenet were developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s using a variety of protocols The ARPANET in particular led to the development of protocols for internetworking where multiple separate networks could be joined together into a network of networks 19
